meanings.definition: To wander or roam around in search of pleasure or amusement.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys galivanting through the park on sunny days.
meanings.sent2: He was caught galivanting around the city instead of studying for his exam.
meanings.sent3: The cat was galivanting around the house, knocking things over in its playful exploration.
meanings.sent4: The children were galivanting like little explorers in the backyard, discovering hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The old man reminisced about his youth, when he would spend hours galivanting in the countryside.

meanings.definition: To go around from one place to another in the pursuit of pleasure or entertainment.
meanings.sent1: During the summer, they love galivanting to different beaches along the coast.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends spent the weekend galivanting from one amusement park to another.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was galivanting around the garden, searching for the tastiest nuts to hoard.
meanings.sent4: The music festival had people galivanting between stages, trying to catch all their favorite bands.
meanings.sent5: The tourists were galivanting through the bustling streets of the city, taking in the sights and sounds.
